message.content:
cs.SD, cs.MM, cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.SDQ 

The paper deals with the problem of generating Ambisonics in 360° videos using audiovisual cues. This involves audiovisual feature-embedding and prediction modules, which are typical of multimedia (cs.MM) and computer vision (cs.CV) research. Additionally, the paper introduces a novel dataset of 360° audio-visual videos, which falls under the sub-category of multimedia. The problem of estimating 3D sound-source locations also involves signal processing (cs.SI) and data analysis (cs.SDQ). Finally, the paper proposes evaluation criteria to investigate the performance of the pipeline, which is a common practice in the sub-category of software engineering (cs.SE).
